poem:
Gaza's Breath  

Among the scarred stones,  
the olive trees stand—  
roots gripping tight,  
whispering to the wind.  
  
In a world of tents,  
children's laughter rises,  
a defiance of hunger.  
  
Their hearts hold the land,  
ancient as the sky—  
We will live here,  
wind and hope entwined.
